column4: Is there any sort of security risks by changing ownsership from root?
of what files?
almost all files outside of your home directory are owned by root
you have two ntfs partitions, correct?
that's fine. the second one is inside an extended partition
i don't think so. sdb5 is a shared partition, right?
meaning a partition you have for sharing data between ubuntu and windows
well, it was a partition that was on my windows system prior to switching it over to Linux.
are you on the live cd?
what mount command gave that error?
A physical second drive.
Error?
I had no error.
oh, sorry, i mixed you up with daleh
heh. since he was talking about something similar.
LOL.
anyway, what you described sounds ok
Ok, I need to make a backup anyways.  I'm slacking on that.
never a bad idea
Yeah.  What's the best way to back up selected folders/files for a web server?
I have some folders containing serveral GB of movie files I don't need to make regular backups of.
and something automated would be ideal.
